content: I can provide information based on research and studies. according to various studies, starting to learn and practice music at a young age may contribute to the development of a lifelong passion for music. early exposure to music can help a child develop an affinity for rhythm, pitch, melody, and harmony. it can also promote cognitive, social, and emotional development. however, it's never too late to start learning and practicing music, and individuals who start later in life can still develop a deep passion and appreciation for music if they are committed to it.
